content_1: Efforts by the city of Seoul, South Korea, to   build a bird observation stand for the public to watch migratory birds have come   under fire as "imprudent" even though the stand with telescope is hundreds of   meters from the birds. The observation stand was planned to be located at the   Kangso Ecological Garden in Pamson, near the Han River. About 5,000 birds of 20   species, including some that originate from Siberia and Mongolia, visit the   region each year. In   Heilongjiang Province, China, officials at local monitoring stations have been   told to keep a close watch over migratory birds at wild bird habitats and live   bird markets for signs of animal epidemics as the province borders South Korea,   where recent H5N1 outbreaks have occurred. Vietnam plans to vaccinate its endangered   white-winged ducks (Cairina scutulata) with a H5N9 vaccine from Italy. It   is estimated that the total population of wild white-winged ducks in the world   is less than 2,500 adults.
content_2: In South Korea, the culling of over 750,000 poultry is close to being   completed. Â The plan was implemented following the discovery of the HPAI H5N1 in   Iksan and at Hwangdeung, in North Cholla province. No additional outbreaks of   H5N1 have been reported.
